message:
do you think the web needs a new interest network
something helps you to connect to the people who share your interests from all over the world
do you think sites like reddit is serving this need well?

data.message: All sorts of interest group sites and forums are online. Reddit is great too, its a very saturated market.
What's the Problem you are trying to solve here?

reddit is the sun in this universe but it even seems like a bookmarking site more than an interest network, i just don't feel being in community when using it

everyone of my interest has a good group somewhere
good publishers somewhere else
and maybe there is an IRC channel on a different world

so the idea is this
all your interests in one place, looks like a social network (just the feeling will make a difference)
have place to publishers to be exist on it
have group chat

is there something like that?

take this example
you are interest in AngularJS
you want to be in it's community to be better in it and to know everything new about it
now there is relatively a good subreddit on reddit for angularjs
if you depend on that only you would miss tutorials from something like nettuts (which makes good tuts) because they just don't post on reddit because it is too tedious (because you should put the post on all subreddit it belongs to, that for every new tutorial or article)

and consider this, you may follow nettuts on facebook or twitter
but you will get all of thier tutorials not juat the angular ones

may be those points are not important, and i am wrong about all of this

what do you think?

Nettuts don't put their posts on reddit because they don't need to.
Not because posting on reddit is tedious and it really isn't...

Communities are formed by the people coexist in it, yet another e-interest group will eventually boil down to one of the preexisting models of online collaboration, like link sharing (HN, DN, Reddit) or a social network (or tools inside a social network)

All of which will eventually involve and require human moderation, if you're feeling isolated from a community that's because you really aren't part of the community. 

Communities form and shape themselves in many ways,  from blog spheres to startup founders meetings to working groups. No single hub will ever host the whole community nor will it advance it forward.

i don't feel i'm part of anything :)
maybe the idea is not filling unsaturated market, or solving a problem which doesn't have a solution or combining the community in one place

i think it more than building a restaurant
you feel the existed ones are okay, but you have an idea for a new one with a new taste that you wish to exist and think that other people will like it

and what is DN? :)
